sense.name: maintain a theory, thoughts or feelings
sense.examples: Somewhere he must always have harbored the hope that he would hear from her. I harbored a lot of resentment as a teenager and as a young adult.

sense.name: (secretly) give shelter to; contain
sense.examples: Researchers have found the human gut to be a major reservoir harboring the HIV virus. Did you know that you are harboring fugitives? Any rental tenant who is harboring a household pet must pay a 300 dollar deposit.
